name: Accounting
description: It is the measurement, processing and communication of financial information about economic entities

Financial Statements.val: Reports the amounts of assets, liabilities, and stockholders’ equity at a specified moment
Reports revenues, expenses, gains, losses, and net income during the period of time
Reports the changes in cash and cash equivalents during a period of time
Includes net income, other comprehensive income, dividends, exercise of stock options
Issued between the annual financial statements
Independent CPA firm gives assurance about reasonableness and compliance with accounting principles
Includes financial statements, annual and quarterly reports to SEC and stockholders, press releases and other financial reports

Balance Sheet.val: Resources, things owned, and prepaid or deferred expenses
A sole proprietorship’s assets minus its liabilities
A corporation’s assets minus its liabilities
Classify into current assets, investments, property, plant and equipment, and other assets
Will turn to cash within one year of the date of the balance sheet
An obligation that will become due within one year of the balance sheet date

Income Statement.val: Amounts earned, sales, service fees, interest earned
Costs incurred to earn revenues, costs used up or expiring during the accounting period
Sale of a long-term asset for more than its carrying value
Sales minus cost of goods sold
Beginning finished goods inventory + net purchases (or cost of goods manufactured) – ending finished goods inventory

Cash Flow Statement.val: The method preferred by the FASB for preparing the SCF
The method used by most companies when preparing the SCF
Activities involving the purchase and sale of long-term assets
Activities involving the borrowing and repayment of debt, long-term liabilities and stockholders’ equity (other than net income)
A separate disclosure containing significant noncash transactions such as the exchange of stock for bonds, stock for land etc

Stockholders Equity.val: Amount received by the corporation from the original issue of its shares of common and preferred stock; contributed capital
The cumulative earnings of the corporation
All changes in ownership interest other than owner investments and distributions to owners
A corporation’s own stock that it repurchased
Distribution of cash to a corporation’s stockholders
Distribution of additional shares of a corporation’s stock to its present stockholders
A stockholders’ equity account that reports the par value of the shares to be issued in the near future as the result of a stock (not cash) dividend
The date a liability (dividend payable) is recorded and retained earnings is reduced
The date which determines which stockholders will receive a dividend
A 2-for-1 stock split means all stockholders’ number of shares of stock will double and should result in a 50% drop in market value of each share of stock
A current liability resulting from a corporation’s directors declaring a cash dividend

Financial Ratios.val: Current assets divided by current liabilities
(cash + marketable securities + accounts receivable) Divided by current liabilities; also known as the quick ratio
Credit sales for a year divided by the average balance in accounts receivable during the same year
360 or 365 days divided by the receivables turnover ratio
The cost of goods sold for a year divided by the average inventory during the same year
360 or 365 days divided by the inventory turnover ratio
One definition is net cash inflow from operating activities minus necessary capital expenditures
Income before interest and income tax expense divided by interest expense
Net sales minus cost of goods sold equals gross profit or gross margin dollars
Net income for a year divided by the average amount of assets during the year
Net income for a year divided by the average amount of stockholders’ equity during the year
Net sales for a year divided by the average amount of assets during the year of the sales
